abstract.p: Maria Cerra Tishman letter on R W Apple Jr's June 14 article recalls sampling Dover sole

block.p: My mouth watered on reading R. W. Apple Jr.'s article ''Best Fishing Hole in St. James's'' (June 14). Fifty-two years ago, after having fenced in the 1948 Olympic Games in London, I joined my teammates for a ferry ride to Ostend, to spend a few days sightseeing in Belgium and France. The trip included a delicious meal onboard. Most of us ordered steak, but the wife of my fencing master urged me to try the Dover sole. ''You can eat all the steaks you want when you get home,'' she said. She was so right! I can still taste the most delicious fish I've ever eaten! Your article brought back many memories.
MARIA CERRA TISHMAN Glen Rock, N.J.
